availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer. Poplar Plains, Kentucky, native. Son of John Newman and Nancy Donovan Newman. Married to Mary Ann Havens Newman in 1834. Father of Leah Newman, Nancy Jane Newman, Simpson R. Newman, Maria E. Newman, Lutieia Newman, Miram Newman, James Minor Newman, and Martha Newman. Farmer in Fleming County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 389. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 66. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 66. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Hillsboro, p. 4. E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians, The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry and Modern Activities, vol. 3 (Chicago, IL: Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), p. 1566.
